data/text_misc.xml.append$/FTL/text[@nam: Speed up everything in the room by \1x for \3 seconds.
Slow down everything in the room by \4x for \6 seconds.
Speed up everything that occurs in a room for a short duration.\nHotkey: \1
Slow down everything that occurs in a room for a short duration.\nHotkey: \1
Tip: Each laser shot will be blocked by a single shield bubble, regardless of the laser's damage.
Tip: Light lasers do no system or crew damage, but reload fast. They still pop shield bubbles too!
Tip: The Neural Laser functions just as any Laser, except it also stuns crew. This is perfect for targeting manned systems, because stunned crew cannot make repairs!
Tip: Frost weapons lock down rooms and briefly stun crew that they hit on top of doing more damage to them. These properties makes these weapons valuable for impeding enemy movements.
Tip: The Anti-Bio Laser cannot pierce any shields nor do any damage to hull or systems, but it is very efficient at killing crew.
Tip: It's a sniper. In space. GO WILD!

Tip: For every one point of ion damage, one power bar is removed from the target system and it is then locked for 5 seconds, preventing re-powering. If an ion weapon hits shields, the damage is automatically applied to the Shield System.
Tip: Fire ions act much like any ordinary ion, but start fires in the room they hit. If they hit while the shields are still up, they will not start a fire.

Tip: Rad ions act much like any ordinary ion, but do additional crew damage to the crew in the room they hit. If they hit while the shields are still up, they will not do extra crew damage, but will still apply the debuff to any crew in the shields room.
Tip: Along with typical ion effects, Stunners temporarily stun crew in the rooms they hit. If they hit while the shields are still up, the stun will be applied to whoever is in the Shield room.
Tip: Phasers pierce all shield layers. They will do ion damage for the first shield layer pierced, plus additional damage to whatever system they hit.
Tip: Plasma weapons are specialized Ancient ions, that do both ion and system damage. If a plasma projectile hits the shields of an enemy, it will both ion AND damage their shields.
Tip: Energy weapons are very versatile as they can do both ion and hull damage, but do not damage crew or systems.
Tip: The Chain Energy decreases its cooldown every time it fires. Check the green lights on the weapon to see how many times it has fired.
Tip: Missiles will ignore all enemy shields, but cost one missile to launch. Enemy defense drones will shoot down incoming missiles.

Tip: This weapon is equipped with Recycler technology, removing its ammo cost, while still granting the usual benefits of Launchers or Bombs. However, the weapon suffers from a longer cooldown as a result.
Tip: The Leto is a very weak Missile weapon. Unlike its elder cousins, it does not have hull-bust attributes, and serves best as a temporary support weapon.
Tip: Heavy missiles always carry hull-bust attributes, making them great for dealing hull damage, but can also be used to quickly take down systems instead if necessary.
Tip: Burst missiles replicate multiple warheads which each do 1 damage. You will only need 1 missile to fire them.
Tip: Missiles shot by this Launcher cannot be targeted by solid-targeting defense drones. However, projectile-targeting defense drones can still intercept them.
Tip: Mine Launchers do no system damage, but have reasonable status effect chances and fire salvos of slow moving mines which pierce all shields. Decent for spreading chaos.
Tip: Kernels function much like missiles, but have a moderate chance to ignore their ammo cost with each volley.
Tip: Elite Kernels are stronger variants of Kernel weapons. They have an increased chance to ignore their ammo cost and have a guaranteed stun chance.
Tip: Spores function much like bombs, but have a small chance to ignore their ammo cost with each volley.
Tip: Chain beams decrease their cooldown every time they fire. Check the green lights on the weapon to see how many times it has fired.
Tip: This System Beam does no hull damage, so it cannot pierce any amount of shields.
Tip: The Breach Beam creates a breach on every tile it hits, and can also pierce a shield layer!
Tip: This Combustion Beam does no hull damage, so it cannot pierce any amount of shields. However, it can damage systems if no shields are present.
Tip: The Mining Beam pierces one shield layer, which means it will not lose any damage for the first shield bubble it pierces. Each layer after that will reduce damage by one.
Tip: This Phase Beam pierces two shield layers, which means it will not lose any damage for the first two shield bubbles it pierces. Each layer after that will reduce damage by one.
Tip: This Anti-Bio Beam does no hull damage, so it cannot pierce any amount of shields. It also won't be as effective on drones.
Tip: This Beam does both crew and system damage, making it a very versatile weapon.
Tip: This Neural Beam does no hull damage, and only has partial piercing. It also won't be as effective on drones.
Tip: This weapon repairs the enemy hull, but not their systems. Useful in junction will hull damaging weapons to pull off miraculous crew kills!
Tip: Pinpoints do higher damage than Beams but have shorter trails. Just like Beams, their damage is reduced by 1 for each shield layer it pierces.
Tip: Particle accelerators fire in a radius much like Flak. Each projectile does small system damage and has a reasonable fire chance, which can be devastating against its target.
Tip: Particle missiles are much more accurate than the accelerator variants, but only fire one projectile. Like all missiles, it pierces all regular shields.
Tip: The Particle Beam does no hull or crew damage, nor can it pierce shields. However, once shields are down it can do heavy damage to systems and light fires.
Tip: Scanners are small, incredibly cheap equipment that do no damage of any kind but can temporarily reveal rooms on either your or the enemy ship.
Tip: Like Heal Bombs, these do not affect ships in any way, but rather apply effects on your own crew, and only your own.
Tip: Using this beam to damage or kill any crew type other than Zoltans is illegal and punishable by death.

Tip: Conservative weapons feed off of power leaks in a system, so they don't need to use any power themselves. As consequence, they take longer to charge and require another weapon to be powered. Can charge additional shots by "firing" when the weapon system is unpowered.
Tip: Battery weapons provide power to the weapons in the slots to the right of them. Allows you to go past the system's normal power limits.
Tip: Radiation weapons do bursts of heavy crew damage, have minor breach chances, and weaken crew that are hit. Afflicted crew will move and repair 66% slower, and will be stunned 75% longer.
Tip: A weapon from a forgotten era and a forgotten race. Useful for any kind of murder.
Tip: A dated weapon originating from a conflict embedded in history. Excellent to harass and murder enemy crew.
Tip: Elite Crystal weaponry are stronger variants of Crystal weapons. They can pierce through two layers of shields, and apply a lockdown to targeted rooms.
Tip: Old weapons are rusty and have much worse aim.
Tip: The powerful tech of the long forgotten Obelisk race, now in your hands at last.

Tip: These weapons are forged from Aether, the exotic and extremely valuable alloy found exclusively in ancient ruins. They are very powerful, but time has not been kind to this weapon. Because of the damage, it will function worse than you suspect it once did.
Tip: Adaptive weapons increase in damage each time they are fired. The damage increase amount and limit depends on the weapon.

Tip: Pre-Emptive weapons can only be fired once per fight, and charge near-instantly. They use no power, but much like Conservative weapons require power to be in the weapon room. If you run from a fight without killing the enemy after firing a Pre-Emptive weapon, it will not be able to fire on the next jump.
data/text_misc.xml.append$/FTL/text[73]: Shots per charge: \1 (1 on own ship)
data/text_misc.xml.append$/FTL/text[@nam: Normal Damage Per Room: \1 (x15 for crew)
Normal Damage Per Shot: \1 (x15 for crew)
data/text_misc.xml.append$/FTL/text[101]: Shots per charge: \1 (1 on own ship)
data/text_misc.xml.append$/FTL/text[@nam: Tip: Toggle Drones can have multiple functionalities. You can switch the mode of as many toggle drones as you want using the toggle button!
Tip: Amp Drones can change their power levels before combat. More power increases their efficiency, but will also require reactor power to function.

Tip: Toggle Drones can have multiple functionalities. You can switch the mode of as many toggle drones as you want using the toggle button!

Tip: Combat Drones require 1 drone part to deploy for each new enemy. They will attack the enemy as long as they are powered.

Tip: Toggle Drones can have multiple functionalities. You can switch the mode of as many toggle drones as you want using the toggle button!

Tip: Defense Drones require 1 drone part to deploy at every new location. They will defend your ship as long as they are powered.

Tip: Toggle Drones can have multiple functionalities. You can switch the mode of as many toggle drones as you want using the toggle button!

Tip: Combat Drones require 1 drone part to deploy for each new enemy. They will attack the enemy as long as they are powered.

Tip: Defense Drones require 1 drone part to deploy at every new location. They will defend your ship as long as they are powered.

Tip: Toggle Drones can have multiple functionalities. You can switch the mode of as many toggle drones as you want using the toggle button!

Tip: Ship Drones require 1 drone to deploy, but will not need to be deployed again until destroyed. They stay on ship and help your crew as long as they are powered.

Tip: Boarding Drones require 1 drone part to deploy for each new enemy. They will board the enemy ship and attack as long as they are powered. If they have not been destroyed, the drone parts will be returned after combat.

Tip: Amp Drones can change their power levels before combat. More power increases their efficiency, but will also require reactor power to function.

Tip: Combat Drones require 1 drone part to deploy for each new enemy. They will attack the enemy as long as they are powered.
Tip: Industrial tech not made for combat purposes. Regardless, it works just as well.
Tip: Scanner drones will permanently reveal enemy rooms even if your sensors are disabled.
Tip: Hull Repair drones fly around your own ship, repairing your hull before exploding.
Tip: Conservative drones use no power on their own, but cannot be depowered once activated.
This item is for your storage only. You cannot use it as a weapon, but it might have other purposes as a trading item or used in crafting!
Defense Drone [Solid-Targeting]:\nShoots down missiles and asteroids. Will function until destroyed or until you jump away.
Defense Drone [Solid-Targeting]:\nShoots down missiles and asteroids. Can be shut down by damaging the enemy ship's drone system.
Defense Drone [Projectile-Targeting]:\nShoots down any projectiles. Will function until destroyed or until you jump away.
Defense Drone [Projectile-Targeting]:\nShoots down any projectiles. Can be shut down by damaging the enemy ship's drone system.
Defense Drone [Drone-Targeting]:\nShoots enemy combat drones. Will function until destroyed or until you jump away.
Defense Drone [Drone-Targeting]:\nShoots your combat drones. Can be shut down by damaging the enemy ship's drone system.
Defense Drone [Asteroid-Targeting]:\nShoots down asteroids. Will function until destroyed or until you jump away.
Defense Drone [Asteroid-Targeting]:\nShoots down asteroids. Can be shut down by damaging the enemy ship's drone system.
Defense Drone [Solid-Targeting]:\nShoots down missiles and asteroids. Will function until destroyed or until you jump away.
Defense Drone [Solid-Targeting]:\nShoots down missiles and asteroids. Can be shut down by damaging the enemy ship's drone system.
Defense Drone [Omni-Targeting]:\nShoots down all projectiles and drones. Will function until destroyed or until you jump away.
Defense Drone [Omni-Targeting]:\nShoots down all projectiles and drones. Can be shut down by damaging the enemy ship's drone system.

data/text_misc.xml.append$/FTL/text[@nam: Ready: Click to become invincible for 15 seconds.\nHotkey: \1
Ready: Click to drastically increase speed for 7 seconds.\nHotkey: \1
Ready: Click to cloak, becoming immune to damage but move slower and do less damage\nHotkey: \1
Not Ready: Not on player ship
Not Ready: Not on enemy ship
Not Ready: No enemies in room
Not Ready: No friendly crew in room
Not Ready: No whitelisted crew in room
Not Ready: No whitelisted enemy in room
Not Ready: No whitelisted friendly crew in room
Not Ready: Blacklisted enemy in room
Not Ready: Blacklisted friendly crew in room
Not Ready: No system in room
Activated: Power currently in use (see duration left of portrait)
Not Ready: Power disabled for AI (shouldn't see this)
Not Ready: No clone bay available
Not Ready: \1 system is not functional
Not Ready: No damaged system in room
Upon examining your map, you realize you just won't have time and need to get to the next sector! You leave the quest for another day.
Defeat the Flagship with Slot A and Slot B of every other ship (excluding the Lanius Cruiser)
These augmentations will have no effect with this augment installed:
Increased scrap rewards and easier enemy generation.
Standard scrap rewards and enemies.\n\nYour score gets a 25 percent boost.
Low scrap rewards and harder enemies.\n\nYour score gets a 50 percent boost.
Toggle advanced information (provides additional information when hovering over crew or reading weapon stats)

Hello and welcome to FTL Multiverse! 
It appears this is either your first time playing the mod, or have not yet set up a new save file! Multiverse has its own save unlock system which it will keep in a separate save. Would you like to transfer vanilla progress, or play with a fresh save? If you transfer progress you will likely be spoiled about content you aren't yet meant to see!
Don't worry, this will NOT influence your vanilla progress in any way.
The full Multiverse experience, with all content enabled.
Disables certain sectors, menus, and equipment. Recommended for beginners. Do note, it is impossible to 100% the game on this mode.

The Multiverse Flagship of this reality has been destroyed. The Rebel forces were weakened, and the Federation troops, along with reinforcements, successfully defeated the Rebel forces of this reality.

After the defeat of the first stage of the Flagship, and seeing the might of the Cruiser responsible, Admiral Vance and the Rebel fleet surrendered. Everywhere across this reality, Rebel forces powered off their weapons. What few splinter groups remained were quickly vanquished, and the survival of the Federation was guaranteed.

Thanks to your help, you revolutionized the Slug government. In close coordination with the new king, you overtook both the Rebellion and Federation, and established a new galactic Slug order that will stand the test of time... for about a decade, before it falls because thieves don't know how to run an economy properly.

Somehow, you have revolutionized the Slug government through a can of beans. In close coordination with Bean Sylvan, you overtook both the Rebellion and Federation, and established a new galactic Slug order that will stand the test of time... for about a decade, before it falls because most people don't accept beans as a legitimate ruler.
Congratulations, you've completed the True Ending to FTL: Multiverse! Though this is the end to the story, obviously there's always more runs to be had. We hope you've enjoyed the mod so far!
Congratulations, you've completed the True Ending to FTL: Multiverse! Though this is the end to the story, obviously there's always more runs to be had. We hope you've enjoyed the mod so far!

With the MFK Flagship and your vessel destroyed, the Paragon was lost in slipspace never to be found again. Though the Obelisk Empire soon collapsed, the Rebellion remained in power, soon replacing Vance's leadership.

After replacing Sylvan Prime as ruler of the Nexus, you used your newfound power to ensure the Multiverse War could never continue. A newfound era of peace spread throughout the Multiverse as the Rebellion, Federation, and other Multiversal Empires were finally forced to keep to their own realities while explorers and renegades like you once were are allowed to roam free.

After replacing Sylvan Prime as ruler of the Nexus, you attempt to continue his legacy of neutrality and order, but many of the Sylvans refuse to accept you as their ruler. Chaos erupts in many realities as new tyrants rise and the war continues, you at least you can enjoy your days lavishly among the spoiled survivors of the Nexus.

After replacing Sylvan Prime as ruler of the Nexus, you become a power hungry tyrant, weaponizing the Nexus and using it to conquer ceaseless numbers of realities. The Multiverse crumbles under your iron fist and trillions die every day. Your image is burned into the mind of every living thing in all of existence as the cruelest dictator to have ever lived.
Thanks to the valiant effort of:
Vicious Vessels, Orchids and Shell Concepts
Stormbringer, SFP, Kix, and many others

Does anyone actually read this far?
(besides you of course)
